result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Korish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will pay CC and Provide a DNA sample/pay surcharge.

DE will be allowed Huber and credit for good time.  DE may serve in LaCrosse County at no expense to Rusk County.  DE will be allowed to serve term on GPS monitoring. DE will have 48 hours from today to start jail time.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A Korish

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: dated 5/25/16 from Atty Keith Belzer with letters of support for DE
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR.

Defendant John A Korish in court with attorney Joseph Gerrit Veenstra.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE will amend plea from NC to guilty.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE enters a plea of G, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  State addresses sentencing recommendations.  Family members would like to make a statement to the court.  Ms McFarland makes a statement to the court, son Dan McFarland addresses the court,  son Matt McFarland wishes for the DA to move to the back of the courtroom during his addressing the court, DA declines, Matt McFarland addresses the court, son Dean McFarland addresses the court.  Atty Veenstra addresses the court.  Friend Matthew O. makes a statement to the court, Andrew K. makes a statement to the court, Dan Thompson makes a statement to the court, DE John Korish would like to address the court, also personally addresses the McFarland family offering personal apologies to the family and others involved.  The court will sentence DE to 120 days jail, credit for good time, huber, CC, DNA sample/surcharge, may serve on GPS monitoring per Lacrosse County guidelines, may serve in LaCrosse county at no expense to Rusk County.  DE will report to jail
